meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods in a trunk.
meanings.sent1: I helped with the trunkings of our luggage for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The trunkings of the old car were filled with groceries.
meanings.sent3: The trunkings of the elephant were so heavy, it needed a break!
meanings.sent4: His trunkings of knowledge were packed into the suitcase of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The trunkings of the moving truck were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A series of interconnected telephone lines.
meanings.sent1: The trunkings of the phone company kept everyone connected.
meanings.sent2: The trunkings of communication were vital during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The trunkings of the phone lines played a melody when calls came in.
meanings.sent4: His trunkings of conversation were like a web connecting people.
meanings.sent5: The trunkings of the network carried voices across the city.

meanings.definition: The main stem of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The trunkings of the oak tree stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The trunkings of the pine tree were sturdy and straight.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the trunkings of the tree as a highway.
meanings.sent4: Her trunkings of branches reached out to the sky like arms.
meanings.sent5: The trunkings of the tree provided shelter for the birds.
